bibl.title: Demostene e Callimaco nel P.Lit.Lond. 108.
bibl.note: Contributo al XV Convegno di Egittologia e Papirologia (Siracusa, 12-14 dicembre 2013). - The first roll of the Aristotelian Constitution of Athens [P. lit. Lond. 108 (= M.-P.3 163; LDAB 391)], contains, among other texts, a rhetorical argumentum with notes in Demosthenes, In Midiam 1-11 [P. lit. Lond. 179 (= M.-P.3 307; LDAB 611)] and three narrow columns with annotations to Callimachus' first book of Aitia [P. lit. Lond. 181 (= M.-P.3 197; LDAB 462)]. In what environment [Hermupolis Magna?] was this papyrus created? Are these literary texts somehow connected to each other? - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Rosa Otranto, Demostene e Callimaco nel P.Lit.Lond. 108.

Contributo al XV Convegno di Egittologia e Papirologia (Siracusa, 12-14 dicembre 2013). - The first roll of the Aristotelian Constitution of Athens [P. lit. Lond. 179 (= M.-P.3 307; LDAB 611)] and three narrow columns with annotations to Callimachus' first book of Aitia [P. lit. Lond. 181 (= M.-P.3 197; LDAB 462)]. In what environment [Hermupolis Magna?] was this papyrus created? Are these literary texts somehow connected to each other? - Avec résumé en anglais.
